title: Champs you thought were op when you started

replies.body:
I've been here since S1 but the first OP champ I discovered was {{champion:11}}  then I quickly realized {{champion:26}} was far better and would get a penta kill with him every game I played him in just about... then they nerfed him... really hard... and dominion came out! and I use to play the old Eve on Dominion! and omg {{champion:28}} was made for that map... Then rammus was OP for a while if you had spell vamp runes... but they screwed up the jungle item that made him awesome... amumu was super OP for a while after that... then Tryn... now I play shaco =\

But the most OP champ forever will be {{champion:99}}

{{champion:17}}

I thought killing bots using DoTs were the most OP things ever.

AD teemo.

I built 5 BotRK and just ambushed people.

Ambrushed?

https://gyazo.com/98c128975e1d01c50ade229d56002487
that is not okay. you sir are a monster. anyone who would stoop so low as to build anything but ludens on teemo more than 4 times is evil.

{{champion:92}} 

I will never enjoy playing against her when it's anyone that's remotely competent.

None really. Most the champions I thought were overpowered I since learned to deal with. Evelynn? Learned to vision and safety. Darius? Learned to safety and duel positioning. Yi? Learned what exhaust, Warden's Mail, Grevious Wounds and Kiting do. 

I started in S2 preseason. There isn't a champion yet that I think is OP I did back then. Some are OP, due to number issues or overloaded kits, but usually Riot fixes those or dumpsters them until a rework.

But if I absolutely had to pick something. Nidalee, simply because regardless of meta or design she has always been a good pick, because her bloated kit is simply... too hard to balance.
Graves (season 3).  He was the first 6300ip champ I bought because I saw someone wreck with him on Twisted Treeline.
